segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it's the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's so focused on those cookies, completely unaware of how unstable that stool looks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit worried for him, hoping he doesn't take a tumble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is tilted, and he's stretched out so far, it's like watching a tightrope walker without a net.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if he's ever fallen like that before, or if this is just another daring adventure for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, waiting for a cookie, but she doesn't seem to notice the danger either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like they're both in their own little bubble, oblivious to the risks around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit frustrated that no one is stepping in to help or guide them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman at the sink is completely unaware, just drying her dishes like nothing else is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy gets his cookie safely, without any mishaps.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just a recipe for disaster, and no one seems to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR
